it's built on top of Vue.js and it's a
meta framework so it allows you to build
server rendered applications client
rendered applications content driven
applications it allows you to build out
API routes and a whole lot more and in
this video I'm going to give you a

going with Nux now this is going to be
fairly introductory to kind of just
acquaint you with what it's like working
inside of a Nux application i have a
much more in-depth course that's coming
soon here on the channel but for now we
can learn the basics of Nux by building

one app demonstrates things like layouts
pages use fetch and async data
serverside rendering client side
rendering loading state and all the
stuff in between so if all of that

my name is CJ welcome to
syntax first let's take a tour of the
Nux website so you can see on the

stuff that it can do first up it doesn't
take much to get going with a Nux app if
you know Vue.js you can already create a
basic Nux app from there they have file
system routing so any page that you want
to create you just create a separate
view file and that will automatically
route to that file next up they have
built-in data fetching which allow you
to request content internally or API
endpoints it also has autoimp imports so
you can define components or composables
and then automatically use those in any
of your components without having to
import them in and of course you can
define API routes and this is powered by
Nitro under the hood so it has
everything you need to build a full
